snippet: The rule, which is open to public comment for 60 days, applies for the first time to makers of “biological medicines,” which are produced in microorganisms, animal or plant cells.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration details plan to prevent drug shortages; fleshes out changes in 2012 law that requires makers of important prescription drugs to notify agency of interruptions in production that might disrupt supply.
lead_paragraph: The rule, which is open to public comment for 60 days, applies for the first time to makers of “biological medicines,” which are produced in microorganisms, animal or plant cells.

headline.main: F.D.A. Lays Out Rule to Avoid Drug Shortages
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Lays Out Rule to Avoid Drug Shortages
